title: Better Chats with AI everywhere
description:
We want the user to be able to have a conversation with an LLM about a given context in many places in the app. First, where do we want the user's to have chats available:
- when editing or creating a story, there needs to be a chat button (at the top next to the close button) that will open the chat interface (in a sidebar to the right of the popup) 
- similarly, when editing or creating a feature
- inside StoryDetailsView there needs to be a chat button (at the top next to the run agent button) that will open a sidebar (on the right) that will allow the user to talk about the given Story and its features.
- inside StoriesListView there needs to be a chat button (at the top next to the run agent button) that will open a chat about the current project and its stories and features.
- following StoryDetailsView and StoriesListView and opening the chat interface in a sidebar to the right, we need a chat button on other screens that will do a similar thing, we need it in Tests and Agents.

Second, each chat is tied to a particular context and must be stored so that whenever the user comes back to the screen where that chat should be shown - the messages history must be resumed. Thus, the contexts are a specific Feature, a specific Story, a specific ProjectSpec, a ProjectSpec's tests and ProjectSpec's Agents. Essentially all these contexts must store appropriate chats somewhere under `.factory/chats` so that they can be easily retrieved via ids. We need `.factory/chats/projectId.json` to be the chat for a specific project, `.factory/chats/projectId/storyId.json` to be the chat for a specific story, `.factory/chats/projectId/storyId/featureId.json` to be the chat for a specific feature, `.factory/chats/projectId/tests.json` to be the chat for a project's tests, `.factory/chats/projectId/agents.json` to be the chat for a project's agents.
Each one of these chats for the different contexts needs to have a different prompt that will come loaded with different information relevant to the context.

This chat interface should be unified and feel familiar across the different projects, the user simply should have an indicator of what context they are in. In this interface the user must be able to choose some settings for that particular context (stored as an app wide setting) - allowing the agent to use certain tools and others not. Choosing the model (similar to how ChatView already does it). Allowing the agent to auto call tools or require user confirmation.
This UI needs to be used anywhere where chats are used (so ChatView needs to benefit from these improvements too).

features.title: Update ChatsManager, ChatsStorage and chatsService
features.description: @src/chat/ChatsManager.ts , @src/chat/ChatsStorage.js and @src/renderer/services/chatsService.ts  already handle storing chats and doing things with them - augment them to handle the requirements for this task - i.e. storing/retrieving contextual chats as well as the settings for them

features.title: Develop a Reusable Chat Sidebar React Component
features.description:
Create a new React component, @src/renderer/components/Chat/ChatSidebar.tsx , responsible for rendering a chat interface. This component will display a list of messages, a user input field with a send button, and the current chat context (e.g., "Chatting about Story: 'User Login'"). It should be a presentational component that receives its state and callbacks via props.
There already is an interface in @src/renderer/screens/ChatView.tsx that should be extracted/consolidated into this reusable one to be used by this Story.

features.title: Add Chat Settings Controls to the Chat Sidebar
features.description: Enhance the @src/renderer/components/Chat/ContextualChatSidebar.tsx   component to include UI controls for chat settings. This includes a model selector dropdown, a mechanism for enabling/disabling tools, and a toggle for the agent's tool auto-approval. These settings will be passed in as props and will trigger callbacks when changed. Use @src/renderer/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx to modify the settings

features.title: Add a Chat Button and Sidebar to StoryDetailsView
features.description: Integrate the `ChatSidebar` into the @src/renderer/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx . Add a "Chat" button to the view's header. Clicking this button will toggle the visibility of the @src/renderer/components/Chat/ChatSidebar.tsx . Wire up the sidebar to the Chat Storage Service to load and save the chat history for the currently viewed story, using the `projectId` and `storyId` as context.

features.title: Implement LLM Communication for the Chat Sidebar
features.description: Connect the `ChatSidebar` to an LLM service. When a user sends a message, it should be sent to the LLM along with the chat history and the context-specific prompt. The LLM's response should then be displayed in the chat and saved to the history. This may involve adapting existing logic from @src/renderer/screens/ChatView.tsx or `thefactory-tools`.

features.title: Create and Load Context-Specific System Prompts for Chats
features.description:
Implement a mechanism to generate and provide a unique system prompt for each chat context (Project, Story, Feature, Tests, Agents). When a new chat is initiated, the appropriate prompt, containing relevant information about the context, should be used as the first message from the system.
The user must be able to see these system prompts and edit them for future cases. There should be an option to go back to the default one always.
This means that @src/chat/ChatsManager.ts and @src/chat/ChatsStorage.ts and @src/renderer/services/chatsService.ts needs to be updated to hold information about the current prompts. There probably needs to be a sub-service for handling all sorts of prompts used by the application.

features.title: Add a Chat Button and Sidebar to StoriesListView
features.description: Integrate the @src/renderer/components/Chat/ChatSidebar.tsx  into the @src/renderer/stories/StoriesListView.tsx . Add a "Chat" button to the view's header. This chat will be for the entire project context. Wire it up to use the Chat Storage Service with the `projectId`.

features.title: Add Chat Functionality to Story and Feature Edit Modals
features.description: Add a "Chat" button to the header of the story and feature creation/editing modals. Clicking the button will open the @src/renderer/components/Chat/ChatSidebar.tsx  to the right of the modal content. The chat context will be the specific story or feature being edited.

features.title: Add Project-Level Chat Sidebars to Tests and Agents Views
features.description: Add a "Chat" button and the `ChatSidebar` to the @src/renderer/screens/TestsView.tsx and the @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx . The chat context for the @src/renderer/screens/TestsView.tsx  will be the project's tests, and for the @src/renderer/screens/AgentsView.tsx it will be the project's agents. Use the file paths `.factory/chats/projectId/tests.json` and `.factory/chats/projectId/agents.json` respectively.

features.title: Implement Persistence for Chat Settings
features.description:
Store the user-selected settings (model, tool configuration, auto-approve) for each chat context. The settings should be saved alongside the chat messages in the corresponding JSON file and reloaded when the user re-opens the chat.
Augment @src/chat/ChatsManager.ts , @src/chat/ChatsStorage.ts , @src/renderer/services/chatsService.ts and @src/renderer/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx to allow modifying these setetings

features.title: Unify Chat Experience by Refactoring ChatView
features.description: Update the existing @src/renderer/screens/ChatView.tsx to use the newly created reusable chat component(s) from the `ChatSidebar`. This will ensure a consistent look, feel, and functionality for all chat interfaces across the application.

features.title: The input box needs improving
features.description:
In the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatInput.tsx  the send button should be an icon -  create one in @src/renderer/src/components/ui/Icons.tsx  . There should also be an appropriate icon for the Attach button.
Both of the buttons should be part of the input view (in the footer with the hints) so that it can take as much space horizontally as possible with just a little bit of padding. The input box should only grow to 30% of the total chat view - no matter where it is used.

features.title: Create speccer chat
features.description: TODO

features.title: Create a chatsContext
features.description:
Instead of @src/renderer/hooks/useChats.tsx there should be a @src/renderer/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx  that follows the same patterns as @src/renderer/contexts/StoriesContext.tsx (giving helpers to resolved contexts per project/story/feature )
@src/renderer/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx needs to be the interface for using @src/renderer/services/chatsService.ts (just like the other contexts use their services).

features.title: Improve the chat sidebar ui on normal screen
features.description:
So in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoriesListView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/TestsView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/AgentsView.tsx - the chat button is in the top right and it makes the chat appear - this should slide out in a nice animation. It should also out collapse the @src/renderer/src/navigation/SidebarView.tsx  as to give more room to the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx .
The whole area/window where the ChatSidebar is should be draggable up to a certain point (50% of the screen) so that it can be expanded or shrunk (up to a certain meaningful minimum - similar to the width the Sidebar is, so. that they are symmetrical). This width setting should be recorded and whenever such a chat is open this width should be resumed.

features.title: Improve the chat UI on popups
features.description:
In @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureCreateView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryCreateView.tsx and @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryEditView.tsx - the chat button at the top opens the chat sidebar in the middle. That's not correct. The way it should be, it's as if the chat sidebar is a 2nd popup that slides out of the current popup to the maximum right the screen has available without changing the popup it slides from. Currently the input box doesn't show in all of these popups when chat is open - it has to be showing.
The chat sidebar when showing should appear sliding from under the popup and to the right - its height should be the height of the popup.

features.title: Improve the top buttons in ChatSidebar
features.description:
When the chat is showing in the sidebar, we don't need to display the title but instead we should show a circular "i" icon, that when clicked will show a tooltip that will show the current context (project, story, feature etc). This should be a reusable component.
The Chat Model selection is currently saving the setting as the overall app model - these two should be separate. The chat model selection should use the same component as elsewhere i.e. like in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoriesListView.tsx the @src/renderer/src/components/agents/ModelChip.tsx is used. It should just have a blue border to separate it from the agent config.
The settings button should be an icon button with the `IconSettings` image.

features.title: ChatInput bottom area
features.description:
In @src/renderer/components/Chat/ChatInput.tsx no need to mention Shift+Enter as normal Enter creates a newline. There should be a little round info button (i) below the send button, that when clicked will show a tooltip of all such shortcuts and helpers that are available in the chat input (which there will be more in the future). The bottom area should hide after over 3 lines have been typed in, making more space for the text. It should reappear if the text is back to 3 lines or less.
The info that is displayed in the area should be always displaying 1 hint per line, where the area can have at most 4 such infos (top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right). Or if there's just one info shown on one side then it would show it centered.
For now we want to show:
"Use @ for file references" and "Use # for stories & features" on the left and on the right just "CMD/Ctrl + Enter to send" where CMD/CTRL is replaced with the appropriate icon for the system.

The buttons: |ATTACH FILE| SEND| INFO| Should be in a vertical section to the right of the chat input box - they should not be a part of the bottom area.

features.title: Make the default prompts be fillable with data
features.description: in @src/logic/chat/ChatsManager.ts there's `getContextPrompt` and it uses a pattern replacement system for the prompts. The prompts in @src/logic/chat/promptTemplates.ts need to be updated to accommodate for these.

features.title: ChatSidebar needs fixing
features.description: @src/renderer/src/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx was updated to use `thefactory-tools` contextual chats implementation, now the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx needs to be updated to accomodate for the changes.

features.title: The chat sidebar on normal screens should be a mirror of the regular sidebar
features.description:
What it means is that the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx on screens like @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx, @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoriesListView.tsx , @src/renderer/src/screens/TestsView.tsx or @src/renderer/src/screens/AgentsView.tsx should be in a vertical panel when collapsed (just like the @src/renderer/src/navigation/SidebarView.tsx when it's collapsed) and expanded the same way as it is now.
The opening button when collapsed should have a left chevron icon - it should be placed analogously to how the opening for the Sidebar is.
When opened, the chat button should transform into a close button - it should be the chevron pointing down.
When the chat area is collapsed - there should be a chat button in the middle of it that will open the chat sidebar.

features.title: ChatsManager should utilise 'thefactory-tools'
features.description:
'thefactory-tools' now exposes saving chat settings and getting prompts - @src/logic/chat/ChatsManager.ts is already exposing the appropriate APIs and so is @src/renderer/src/services/chatsService.ts . Now @src/renderer/src/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx can have the functionality which can be used inside @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx and the settings panel in there to toggle tools to be available or not, and to be auto called or not (via 2 separate toggles). The settings panel must also give the option to edit the prompt that is assigned to that ChatContext and inside @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx to show it before any messages are sent.
All the necessary files from 'thefactory-tools' can be found under the path `node_modules/thefactory-tools/src/chats`

features.title: The Chat screen needs an overhaul
features.description:
The @src/renderer/src/screens/ChatView.tsx needs to now list chats according to context so a user can easily find all chats based on the different contexts.
The sidebar showing the different chats, so a scrollable list with tiles representing the different Context Type combinations. Clicking on a chat will open it in the main area.
Creating a new chat, always creates a new General chat with the current timestamp.

The way the sections in the ChatView sidebar should work is the following:
|GENERAL|
-----------
|project chat|
|STORIES|
|TOPICS|

GENERAL, STORIES and TOPICS are sections that can open up to reveal either chats (listed first) or sections within (like STORIES -> FEATURES or TOPICS -> TESTS).
GENERAL needs to show all the general chats across all projects.
All the chats in a given section are sorted by the last update date.

features.title: ChatSidebar rework
features.description:
The @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx doesn't work properly - it stays collapsed in the panel - in @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebarOverlay.tsx . The way to solve it, is that ChatSidebar must get a parameter `isCollapsible` passed in - then it would display its own collapse button which would via callback call the setCollapse of whoever is calling it. For instance in @src/renderer/src/screens/ChatView.tsx it won't be passed in because there it stays fully open and taking up the whole screen.
ChatSidebarOverlay needs to be renamed to ChatSidebarPanel and it will control the `setCollapsed`. It should be further split/refactored to a separate component ChatSidebarModalPanel that will only contain the logic for handling Modals/popups as used for instance in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx .

features.title: ChatPanel buttons
features.description:
The buttons should be horizontally centered, the close button at the top and the chat button in the middle.
Th background should stretch all the way to the bottom (right now it gets clipped some way below the chat button).

features.title: ChatSidebar settings panel
features.description:
The settings panel in @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx is not displaying the prompt for the given chatContext.

The tools that are displayed should have the toggles displayed in this way:
|TOGGLE1|TOGGLE2| where they are vertically stacked on the right with a small gap between. One of the toggles has the following display:
|LABEL|SWITCH| where they are vertically stacked and the label is of a small font size just above the switch (minimal gap of 1px).

When a available tool is turned off then the auto-call one is turned off by default and disabled.
When a switch is disabled it should be distinctly different than a turned off switch.

features.title: Hovering or clicking the (i) button at the top flashes
features.description:
In @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx , the top (i) bar strangely flashes instead of showing the information the whole time - but this only seems to happen when the hover comes from the right side and not when it comes from the left.
Clicking it should also show the tooltip.

features.title: The bottom right ChatInput info button should work on hover
features.description:
In @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatInput.tsx the (i) button only works when clicking on it - it should work on hover too.

Additionally, when hovering over the Attach files button - it should show "Attach Files", and the send message button should show "Send".

features.title: When opening a modal chat it crashes
features.description:
For instance in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/FeatureEditView.tsx when opening the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebarModalPanel.tsx it crashes with the following error:

ChatSidebarModalPanel.tsx:37 React has detected a change in the order of Hooks called by ChatSidebarModalPanel. This will lead to bugs and errors if not fixed. For more information, read the Rules of Hooks: https://react.dev/link/rules-of-hooks

   Previous render            Next render
   ------------------------------------------------------
1. useState                   useState
2. undefined                  useState

features.title: LLMConfig setting
features.description:
Chats need to have the LLMConfig stored separately from the AgentRun LLMConfig. In @src/renderer/src/screens/settings/llms/LLMSettings.tsx and @src/renderer/src/contexts/LLMConfigContext.tsx there should simply be another field for the activeChatConfig .
The @src/renderer/src/screens/settings/llms/SettingsLLMConfigModal.tsx needs to be updated to have a button showing which config is the Chat active one and allow setting it via that screen.

features.title: Modal chat sidebar improvements
features.description:
All the modals that use @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebarModalPanel.tsx should have the collapsed panel showing by default and they should no longer show the open chat button in the top right.

Additionally, some of these modals can be very small and the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatInput.tsx at the bottom ends up not showing. The top and bottom of the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx should always show, the top having always a constant size, and the bottom can have the maximum constrained to 40% of the total parent size.

features.title: System prompt display
features.description:
When there are no messages the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx is displaying the system prompt at the top. Right now this can be very big, so it should be a special bubble that is centered (similar in style to the user/assistant message bubbles - but in a different gray - color scheme). It should be constrained to always have a certain max size (30% of the container size) and min size (showing 3 lines), and it should thus be vertically scrollable if need be.
When there are messages, we should always show this system prompt as the first message.

features.title: The drag handle must be more distinct and wider
features.description: In the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx the drag handle might be very close to another screens scroll bars thus making it almost invisible. The handle should protrude to the right (so short on the left and wide on the right) and be of a teal hue to make it stand out from scrollbars. The handle should have vertical bars illustrating that it's a drag handle.

features.title: The chat panel should have a left border similar to Sidebar's
features.description: The @src/renderer/src/navigation/SidebarView.tsx has a border on the right, @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebarPanel.tsx  should have the same on the left. When a @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx is collapsible, it should also have the same border.

features.title: Chat context for system prompt
features.description:
Currently the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx  doesn't pass on the correct context arguments to @src/renderer/src/contexts/ChatsContext.tsx  when calling `getSettingsPrompt`.
The type is in the comment above the function in ChatsContext.
It expects to get whatever is part of the context inside - so if it's a chat about a feature, it expects a ProjectSpec, a Story and a Feature. If it's a ProjectsTopic - then a ProjectSpec. If it's an Agent run - then a ProjectSpec, a Story and a AgentRunHistory.
These need to be appropriately retrieved via the other contexts and passed on here so the system prompt is populated correctly.

features.title: ChatView sidebar should be collapsible
features.description: In @src/renderer/src/screens/ChatView.tsx the sidebar which contains the list of chats should be collapsible with a button in the top left of it (similar to how the sidebar works like in @src/renderer/src/screens/SettingsView.tsx ). The title should be gone from the top and the `Create Chat` button should be a `+` button like in @src/renderer/src/screens/stories/StoryDetailsView.tsx for creating features.

features.title: In ChatSidebar the typewriter effect should only trigger for an assistant message that just came in
features.description: While the user has the @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx  open and the assistant message comes in - then trigger the typerwiter effect. Right now it triggers on the last assistant message no matter when the sidebar opens.

features.title: Saving the prompt doesn't auto update the prompt display
features.description: In @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebar.tsx when saving the prompt in the settings panel - it doesn't auto update the prompt to send (it should only do this when there haven't been any messages yet sent).

features.title: The chat modal panel should have no border and have rounded corners
features.description: The @src/renderer/src/components/chat/ChatSidebarModalPanel.tsx
